The BEST Macaroni and Cheese Recipe EVER!
Ingredients:
1 8 oz. box elbow macaroni
4 tbsp. butter
4 tbsp. flour
1 cup milk
1 cup heavy whipping cream
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. black pepper
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
Directions:
Cook and drain macaroni according to box instructions. While the macaroni cooks, melt butter in a large saucepan. Add flour, salt, and pepper. Gradually add milk and cream, whisking constantly over medium high heat for about 5 minutes or lumps are removed and thickened. Reduce heat to low, fold in cheese just until completely melted. Add macaroni and toss in cheese! Stay tuned for my *special* gluten-free version!

How to Deal with Nosy People
Ever wonder why you keep finding people’s nose in your business? Nosy people want to know what’s going on in your life because . . let’s face it, their life is lame. So, join their pity party just feel sorry for them and hope they find their own happiness one day very SOON. Until then, here are a few ways to help you deal with them:
-Less is more. That means give less information about your business. Just ask them about themselves, that works everytime
-Only give them as much information as you are comfortable with.
-If they are persistent, don’t be afraid to tell them (in a sensitive way) that it’s not something they need to know.
-Remember to keep your enemies closer than your friends. Enemies seek to destroy your happiness!
-Be NICE to everybody! It kills miserable people that they were unsuccessful at trying to bring you down!!!

Chocolate Mousse Recipe (Allergen-Free)
Ingredients:
1 cup (8 oz) chopped chocolate chips (I use vegan Enjoy Life Mini Chocolate Chips)
2 tbsp. butter
1/2 cup water, divided
2 tbsp. sugar (I use evaporated cane juice)
3 egg yolks
1 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream, whipped (whip with a mixer on high speed)
Directions:
In a small bowl, combine the chocolate chips, butter, and 1/4 cup of water. Microwave or heat until melted. Stir until smooth. Set aside. In a small sauce pan, combine 1/4 cup of water, sugar, and egg yolks. Whisk over LOW heat for 1-2 minutes. Add chocolate mixture to the egg mixture. Set pan on ice until cooled completely, about 5 minutes. Fold in whipped cream! Refrigerate until set, overnight or indulge right away, like I do.

How to Save Money on Insurance
1. Shop around–Request quotes and compare prices from reputable companies, a little time and research can really pay off!
2. Quality/consumer reviews–Company reputation is important, so by reading reviews you might be able to avoid low quality service in the future and learn something new.
3. Raise your deductibles–The higher your deductible, the lower the cost of your premium!
4. Bundle up!–That means taking out auto insurance, homeowners insurance, renters insurance, motorcycle insurance, RV insurance, boat insurance, etc. with the same company is an easy and convenient way to save money!
5. Qualify for hidden discounts–You may qualify for discounts you won’t even think of, so research and ask which ones you qualify for.
6. Consider pay as you drive–It’s the newest thing offered by most insurance companies. It may or may not work with your lifestyle, but it doesn’t hurt to check into it!
7. Don’t go without–YOU NEVER KNOW WHEN YOU’RE GOING TO NEED IT . . .
